reviews.text: I love the idea, but there are few historic plaques/markers and nearly all the buildings are private. There is very little tour literature. With a little bit of improvement, this could be a really good learning experience.
A nice little walk (about 45 minutes) to make on a sunny day. Download the audio book ($1.20) beforehand so you can hear the stories behind the places you visit.
Worth a stroll so much to learn about in this City. Walk and learn

Very interesting history and nice walk through a beautiful neighborhood.  Cool to see one the first public schools for african americans in the counrty.  Note the sights arent all marked.... finding them required some persistence and googling.
Best light post I've ever seen I don't. Know how it doesn't turn off

Scheduled a tour online for terminal tower in advance (about $5PP). Staff was friendly and there was no wait upon arrival to the tower. Views were gorgeous! Did not feel rushed during visit; 30 minutes at the top is more than enough. Would highly recommend.
A beautiful scene inside and outside. Lots of stores and quick eats. Alot of history here. You can enjoy a day here..

Great view and worth the price. Unfortunately, the staff is awful. You can't buy tickets at the location, only online. The lady at the desk just dismissed us after telling us to buy the tickets online, refusing to give us any more information.  It's confusing trying to figure out where to go in the building and the security officer actually made fun of us instead of helping us.  Most people and places in Cleveland are great but this one was disappointing.
The most beautiful building in Cleveland. Looks great in the evenings.
Great ambience.
Me and my friends walked from West side to tower city then back. 3 miles, nice scenery! I love my Cleveland Ohio!
Grey design element juxtaposed by its location. Very interesting bridge.
Nice walk into Ohio city

Nice ply area, bot alot of parking. The additional parking in the area requires payment in old fashioned meters that only takes quarters!. Who carries cash or change with them. I did happen to find a couple of times and nickles in my purse, but no, meters only took quarters. Also no restrooms around. So all the business around won't give change or let you use the restroom

Gorgeous bridge that will lead you straight to downtown. the "two guardians stand tall protecting the grand entrance to the city" and overall it's a pretty spectacular view. It is also a great place to watch cityscape at night.
A nice spot to view what Cleveland has to offer , nice rest stop with little bit of history about it .
Amazing monument. Extremely detailed. Would like to go in the catacombs.

Perhaps one of the finest Civil War monuments erected in the North or South. Memorial for 9,000 plus Cuyahoga County soldiers killed from 1861-1865. Incredible hand carved marble & awesome bronze sculpture by the noted architect & artist Levi Scofield. Do not miss this American treasure when in Cleveland.
Very cool random monument in the middle of downtown. Went in to get out of the humidity for a few minutes but ended up staying and enjoying the displays and history!
If you're from Cleveland, visiting, or just passing through, you have got to check out the soldiers and sailors monument! Make sure to be on the look out for tunnel tours underneath it!

Really interesting activities for kids of all ages.  Loved to see a moon rock.  The kids enjoyed the moon landing simulation game.  The race car exhibit was lots of fun with interesting matchbox car tracks and a build your own mini race car station.  Lots of interesting science activity stations to explore science concepts from color optics to motion, oscillation and pulleys.

The kids had a blast at the science center playing with all fun displays! The IMAX movie about the Great Barrier Reef was a good time too. The space exhibit was very interesting and lots to do for the kids! I'm several decades beyond the target age but still enjoyed my visit. Teens and younger would no doubt get more benefit from the interactive learning aids.

We had such a great time with so much to do.  We spent over 5 hours here and could have spent more time but they were closing. We enjoyed it better then the imagination station. More things to do and touch for children of all ages.

Has something for all ages. My toddlers, 11 year old, my wife and I all had a good time. The kids play room was nice to let the kids loose to play and run around. Lots of fun science stuff to learn about. Things get changed around with new stuff every so often to entice locals to return.

This place has a lot to over, I felt like kid and I started playing in everything. We really enjoyed our time here. It took us around 2 hours and a half to eat in the cafeteria and walk around with trying and playing in almost everything 😁 two missing stars because I wish it was bigger and I  hope they trying to improve the center more. I also would be happier if they make it cheaper 😋. Oh by the way if you’re a student show them the student ID.
The money museum is free and fun. A great way to spend an hour or so. A lot of interactive exhibits and great for all ages.

Good place to see ... money museum . History of money and short film is worth to watch . Guests have very restricted access and hence try to make most out of it. Helpful for children which are older than 10 years . Lot of interactive games and learning experience.
Great free stop! Stunning building with some history of money and the reserve. My kids are 11 & 7, they both enjoyed it. Plan for about an hour.

The exhibits are fun and educational - best to visit with a school class or some way that you can get a tour because the building is AMAZINGLY beautiful! Don't forget to get your souviner bag of shredded money before you leave! (Dont let your kids open it to try and put bills back together. Not only do they not give you what you need to put them together  (duh), but the shredded money is much more disgusting than most would anticipate!

This place is a hidden gem!  We found this on a site of free things to do in Cleveland.  It's beautiful and loads of fun. Only takes a few hours,  kids and adults can learn to spot counterfeit bills, learn to barter, design your own money, learn the history of money, etc. It's definitely worth a trip to this hidden gem!
Went to see the Free stamp. Overcast/drizzle day but not too bad. Great view of Rock Hall in distance.
Nice, scenic surroundings, Free Stamp statue, Lake Erie view.. nice place to spend the evening !!
Very well maintained park in the downtown. Many walkathon, marathons are organized around it, has lot of greenery in midst of tall buildings which give a fantastic view to the whole area.
We love stopping at the various "world's largest" while on our trips.   We enjoyed seeing the Worlds Largest Rubber Stamp!  Some quick 10 minute tourist parking would be a nice touch.
Great way to spend the day venturing.
Food was decent and the prices were very reasonable. There's plenty of choices from one end of the street to the next end. A must visit when you come to Chumphon.
So fun ! Got the deepfried bread with coconut frosting
Night market not big but definetelly worth visiting
Small nigh street shopping.
Nice attraction for tourist that visit Chumphon. The mango rice and the thai pastry shop next to it is a must try and you can find all sorts of delicious desserts along the night bazaar.

Super tasty food and a surprisingly low price. Good quantities. Speedy and friendly service. The pad thai was flavorful and creamy with a good amount of kick. It was packed with veggies, chicken, and tofu. I wasn't a fan of the sweet steam bun but the pineapple smoothie was excellent.

Wonderful little spot in downtown Cleveland! We were looking for Thai food before the Cavs game, and found this gem. My kids especially loved the pad thai... and the owners! The father and daughter team were so friendly and accommodating... we look forward to seeing them again next time we're in the area.

Went when it was slow and the staff were warm and friendly, leaving the good impression. The bowl I got left me kinda dissapointed but after trying the combos of my friends I think it might have mostly been my choice.

Unfortunately, I'm very disappointed. This was my first time trying you guys and almost everything about my order was unpleasant. My combination bowl (Sweet-Red Sauce w/ Brown Rice) was too sweet; I even tasted the rice without the sauce & it was also sweet. The mushrooms in my Miso soup tasted like rubber bands. The vegetables in the bowl was nothing but lettuce greens, I really thought I was going to get a vegetable variety. I wish I could get my money back. The only thing that was okay was the Vegetarian Steamed bun but the Teriyaki sauce was also too sweet and was filled with lettuce greens. I thought I found a new place to eat at on my lunch break but unfortunately, I will not return.

**I must add that Patricia was very responsive, kind & considerate of my experience and handle the situation. Very thankful of that. Maybe I'll give them another try.**
Food was late or never ready but great taste.

I bought the “mustache of fire” hot pickles at a store in Cleveland for 8 dollars!!!
WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT
We’re they hot? 
Yea kind of, but that’s subjective.
These pickles were F-ing mush! No snap! No crunch! They honestly offered about as much “crunch” as an olive from a jar. The mouth feel and flavor are TERRIBLE the hotness is the only aspect of these that are even remotely  acceptable. I would return this jar in a heartbeat if I thought the refund would come out of Randy’s pocket and not the store from which it was purchased. I’d set MY mustache on fire before I’d ever buy another jar of them! Utter waste not just of my money but of the manufacture’s time these pickles couldn’t possibly bring pleasure to anyone. Randy if you’re reading this:
If you had any heart you’d steal for a living! 
If as a consumer you’re thinking about getting some do yourself a favor and chuck $10 in the sewer it’d be a better use of everyone’s time and money.
I really tried to give a 0 star review (which these pickles deserve!) but apparently it isn’t possible. So 1 Star will have to generously suffice.

Mustache On Fire pickles are crisp and with a fair amount of heat.  Unfortunately not much flavor to go with it.  I haven't tried the other pickles from them so hopefully they taste better.  McClures's Pickles owns this category!
Different flavors, all delicious

I just bought a jar of Grandma Knows Best Peppers. The flavor was great and I really enjoyed the heat. However, I didn’t care at all for the texture of the peppers. They were mushy which was really disappointing since I paid $8.49 for a jar.
Pricy for the sizes you get
Guys were great!! We locked ourselves out of our car on our anniversary. They were quick and super personable in downtown traffic during a hockey game!!
Lost our dogs ID tag somewhere in downtown Cleveland and Sekia dropped it off at our front desk! All of the DCA employees we run into downtown are very friendly and keep our city looking good!
Good for Cleveland. Keep up the good work.
Nice for traveling
I love what the Alliance does for Downtown Cleveland! Keep going!

Very disappointing experience. After a long day of apartment hunting, we made last minute reservations to dine here. We were only in town for less than 48 hours and wanted to make the most of our last meal in the city. We walk in and the place is empty and it seemed like we’d gotten ahead of the dinner crowd-which is a plus, because we were really hungry! The manager, I’m assuming, sat us where we wanted and we started to review the menu. 

Seven minutes later and no one had even as much as offered us a glass of water. Seven whole minutes. In the restaurant business, that is an eternity. Had the place been packed, we would have been more understanding. That wasn’t the case. The two female servers continued their conversations, a couple walked into the bar and were immediately served and finally a male server walked right by us and started to talk to the manager who’d sat us down. 

My friend went and asked if we’d be served and by that point, I was ready to go. So we left. The manager apologized and said “oh, we’ll do better next time”. That didn’t seem too genuine and even if it was, there won’t be a next time. 

How insanely disappointing. The menu looked great and the location also appealing; the service, however, did not satisfy us. 

We went to The Chocolate Bar instead and felt very welcomed.
They have great food here. I love eating here before a show. This is a fun place to go on a date night
I love GOOD wings that are well done, with just the right seasoning...and full-sized wings. The fried mushrooms and the garlic pram wings was enough for two people to share and delicious.
Some of the best food in Cleveland! Get in before the dinner crowd and expect a quick ticket time for your meal. Been going for years, and will continue to go for years.

Great food and atmosphere.  Friendly service. My wife and I went here this evening for valentine's day dinner . First time we have gotten to go out for dinner just the two of us in a long time.  We enjoyed everything they had to offer . Highly recommend coming here next time we are going to try to make a show at helarities .

Great food, great atmosphere. Wednesday night half price wine bottles a bonus!   Servers were friendly and attentive. This was my second time there and enjoyed it both times.  Will definitely be back. Menu had nice variety.  Road appetizers and entrees.

We have not been to Hodges in quite a while. Returned during Downtown Cleveland Restaurant Week to try the $30 prix fixe menu.  The salad was mixed greens with goat cheese, candied walnuts, and berries. The portion was the size of a meal even though it was the first course.  The champagne vinaigrette dressing was the perfect complement. The main course was a seafood risotto that was rich and creamy and delightful. The dessert menu included a warm brownie with ice cream. We were also offered a gluten free dessert option which is one of the hallmarks of Driftwood restaurant group. They are very solicitous and will cater to dietary needs.  All of the portions were very large even considering that this menu was a very reasonable $30 for all three courses.  The server was excellent and the manager came over at the end of the meal to ask us about our meal experience and to chat with us. All in all, this was an outstanding experience.

The dish i ordered was absolutely amazing.
The place has a very different ambience that makes you feel very lively while you're there.
Not only the food makes you fall for this place , but also the amazingly helpful and polite staff does that.
I would love to visit this place again and try the other things in their menu as well.

We came for date night on Valentines Day and what a waste of date night. I gave this place a 2 because the server was great!  I got the seafood risotto and hardly any seafood and what was in there was tough. The corn bread was uncooked and croutons if our salad were so salty . Won’t be back !!

The sandwiches are amazing and the people are super nice. 
Great place to eat a good price for the value.
Staff is very understanding and they also maintain the cleanliness of the area efficiently.
Sometimes it's a long wait but it's worth the WAIT.

The food here is excellent! A lot of very diverse options with lots of variety for all tastes. The prices are great! I had three custom tacos that were a decent size and spent less than $10. I'm from Phoenix, AZ and I highly recommend this place!

This is my favorite taco place in the Cleveland area. Love taking people from out of town here. The food is all really good and they always have awesome unique drinks on the menu. The different shells for the tacos really make this place unique. Can't wait to come back.

Amazing service!  We brought six kids and four adults here for lunch and the staff was incredible. We were blown away by the friendliness and attention given to us to make our lunch so awesome. The food was delicious as always and came out very quickly. The chips were constantly refilled which kept the kids very happy. The french toast was delicious!  The only tricky part was parking. We used the valet service from the hotel next door because street parking was restricted. The hefty valet fee was more than worth it though because we had such a great experience. Thank you, Barrio!!

Serve and food was awesome! The Cher concert let out, and the place was instantly flooded. The staff was amazing. Service wasn't interrupted at all. They sailed through the challenge with ease. Food was spot on. I would definitely go back. Loved their flavors. Perfect pricing.

I love the ambience. The way the natural light hits during the day makes it bright. Such a great place to catch up with friends. Everything on the menu is delicious. Worth it all. 5 stars.Worth giving it a try! Definitely coming back!

I like to eat here at least once a year, and have been doing so for at least 10 years. The antipasto buffet is always wonderful. Meats are perfectly prepared and brought out in a very timely fashion. After the first round the waiters ask what you would like to taste again. Nice chic interior.
I love Brasa. It's perfect for date night. The salad bar has a great selection. I always get the crab legs, and the meat they bring around is always so juicy and tender. Definitely would recommend!
Went here to celebrate my birthday. The food here was amazing.  While it is a bit pricey but the amount of food you get is a lot.

Terrible. Worst Brazilian Steakhouse that I’ve ever been to… The servers sometimes took 15 to 20 minutes before they came back around with other meats which defeats the purpose of a Brazilian steakhouse… Came here for my girlfriend’s birthday and would never recommend it to anybody ever. Also, every dish was not hot at all, other than one of the meats. Do not recommend.

Endless meat comes to your table.So Delicious. Flip your card as soon as you're done or just need some time to make room. As soon as you're ready flip your card back over and they'll continue coming by with more meat. There's about 12 different kinds of meat eat as much as you want but there are no doggie bags. Endless supply of meats and salad bar will cost you about $40. But you must try a signature drink while you're there I recommend one of their martinis

Had a great experience at Lola, would recommend. Very appealing menu. I had the scallops which were perfectly cooked. The atmosphere is moody, great for a date. The service was wonderful!  My only hang up is that the entree prices are a bit expensive for Cleveland.

My spouse and I had a great dinner here. I had scallops and my spouse had a pork chop. Both dishes were delicious. The care in preparation and presentation of the food with varying and layering of textures and flavors was fantastic. I topped it off with chocolate cake for dessert. A great experience at Lola's all around, worth the price of admission!

The restaurant is beautiful. The staff provided excellent service.  Docked one star because the bone marrow appetizer is not worth the $26 price tag.  That being said, my hanger steak was worth every penny of its $35 price.  Would definitely return for a special occasion meal.

The hanger steak was possibly the most amazing piece of beef I have ever had in my life. And the bacon wrapped sturgeon was to die for. (I was nervous about the bacon, because I love sturgeon on its own, but it worked!)

Great food I got white chocolate and cashew ice cream. Poached pear with fig pudding cake and caramel. For entree we had scallops and lamb with a side of mushrooms. Great atmosphere was a bit hot sitting by the cooks.

Was here on a mini getaway and wanted some steak so we searched steak houses and came across this place. Looked a little sketchy on the outside but as soon as we went in it was absolutely gorgeous! The service was wonderful and the food was delicious, a little on the pricey side but you definitely get what you pay for. Would definitely come back if we're in the area again.

Best steak in my life. Servers are amazing and polite. I'm really nobody but they treat you like your special. That's how service should be! I am always wowed. Seriously best steak. Seasoned amazingly and seared to perfection. Wife says the rack of lamb is best she's had as well. Good mac n cheese. Great drinks. Desserts change. I once had a chocolate tart with earl grey custard. It was amazing. Creme brulee on another visit was satisfying. Love whiskey. Eating here is worth every penny.

My son came home for the holidays.  After one of our excursions out, he decided to take me out for a nice dinner.  One of his favorites in Cleveland.  Since it was spur of the moment, we did not have a reservation. We were offered seats at the bar.  Our service was impeccable.  The wine was very good. The food... The food was delicious. I couldn't eat everything. Even reheated it was just as good.  Looking forward to visiting again.

I went to Red recently and had the best service I’ve ever received. It may be a little pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for. The steaks were cooked perfectly and the desserts were phenomenal!

Took three friends of mine to Cleveland the weekend before Christmas. I am a native, they are all from Chicago. Wanted to show them the best of Cleveland. Did the Orchestra Christmas Concert, Pier W brunch, etc. Ate and drank to access. 
The highlight and favorite spot for all of us was Red’s!! Had been there before and was sure it would not only impress my friends but show them Cleveland at it’s absolute best!! 
Atmosphere is perfect Steakhouse fare. 
Welcoming, comfortable, great corner booth where we could all chat and observe. The food was fantastic from the Steak Tartar, the sides, the phenomenal Filet, and finally, my favorite...fresh, warm, powder sugar covered doughnut holes, with dipping sauces!!
The service was spectacular; engaging, knowledgeable, friendly, humorous. The entire evening there was absolutely perfect. Great friends, great place, incredible time. Thank you Red’s for helping me show my friends why Cleveland truly rocks!!!

Hopefully Carla is your waitress. We just came from the baseball game. Dressed in sports clothes in this classy restaurant. She didn’t bat an eye. Wonderful human. Excellent firsts and seconds. 
Btw. We are from out of town. She made Cleveland for us.  Coming back!!
Great food... great staff...good vegan/gluten free options as well as non-vegan, gluten-full options. Very close to the Q and a fun place to spend time waiting for games to start.
Absolutely delicious food and super fun and casual atmosphere! Our server Kevin was awesome and made the experience that much more enjoyable! Great drinks as well- especially their Em’s Cup.

This was isn’t just a burger place, this is a place where you go to experience, good service, food that is prepared almost as fast as fast food McDonald’s burger (exaggerating)! The food was excellent, the fries dipped in that sauce that they offer, was the best flavor, and I don’t even know what it was!! The burger was the best burger I have had in Ohio! I think our group experience lasted about 30 minutes!! That means going in, ordering the food, them preparing the food, then bringing it out, us eating the food, then paying! All in thirty minutes!! 10/10 recommend this place for everyone who is either visiting for the baseball game, or the basketball games!! Will replenish your hunger, even if your team ends up losing :)

Alice was the greatest server we’ve ever had. She made fantastic recommendations to our table, and felt like a friend to us all. A tasteful amount of banter and conversation with each time she pre-bussed or took our orders. Next time we’re in Cleveland, we’ll make sure to pay The Greenhouse and Alice a visit.
One of the best places to go in Cleveland with young kids. Very fun play area, tons of cars, and a CAROUSEL! We parked at the Natural History Museum and just crossed the street to go in. So fun!

Wonderful, modern museum with lots of great history on the city of Cleveland, old cars and the old Euclid Beach Park Grand Carousel that you can ride twice with a paid admission. The mansion tour is nicely done and full of interesting artifacts from different time periods.
Great museum for local history.   Lots of cars.   Also has the Euclid beach carousel and able to ride on it.   Also attached is a early 1900's house to tour.

What an unknown gem of a museum! The fact it is made from two historic houses and has an indoor carousel sets it apart from any other museums across the country. They have interesting features for children up to older adults. The working carousel is handicap accessible and the day we were there a group of people boarded on their wheelchairs to enjoy multiple rides. It warmed our hearts. We will bring our tour groups back for a visit.

History buffs for Cleveland's mansion-era including Hay-McKinney mansion (attached to the museum).  Also includes the Crawford car collection and the historical restored Euclid Beach Carousel.  They should have a separate entrance if you just want to ride the carousel, though.

The Crawford Auto Museum was very interesting. They had a interactive worksheet at entrance that kept kids engaged. The auto exhibit and facts about Cleveland were very interesting. The Carousel from Euclid Beach was nostalgic. I loved the tour of the mansion and history lesson. Our entire family had an awesome time.

It was wonderful I had no idea it was that big. The dang thing has two floors of cars planes and motorcycles, a huge carousel, 2 not 1 but 2 mansions, a library, and much more. Just make sure you go early they close at 5 but you definitely wanna catch the tour at 3 it was amazing.

A hidden gem in "Museum row".  Love that they showcase the large role Cleveland played in the auto industry-over 100 and some different cars were manufactured here. Visit the website and take a tour.  Great for a rainy day.

Great place for car and history buffs. The mansions are very ornate and 
 well worth a slow walk-through. Quiet atmosphere. Great place to relax.

Very nice place for the day. There is a lot to see and do. My favorite thing was the carousel.  It was fun and can ride it all day. There is alot for the family to do. Good place for everyone to go. I would recommend it for out of town people. Looking forward to go back. I am excited!

Wonderful old house and tavern with numerous old tools, as well as many other old things. The tour is very nice, informative, and professional. I recommend this place to anyone, whether they like history or not.
Summer Gardening

Dunham Tavern is the "oldest building in Cleveland in that is at it's original location". The museum today is a collection of period artifacts that give you a sense of what daily life for 1836 tavern-keepers might have been like. See wooden boot-pullers, pewter dishware (contains lead!), tin coffee roasting machines, lead-lined tea boxes, rough kitchen tables, a wooden bar in the taproom, a musket and the wall, and (my favorite part) maps and engravings of the Cleveland-of-the-past.

There are only three things in the museum that were owned by the Dunhams themselves (needlepoints made by their daughters and a dresser) and several period artifacts that were not likely used by the Dunhams (flax spinning equipment).

My tour guide made all of the old things come alive! This building has stood by as Cleveland moved through many eras --- it is an interesting vantage point from which to think about Cleveland and American history.

Dunham Tavern is worth a visit if you can stop by during one of its elusive open times. At other times you can explore the gardens or stop by the farm stand to buy food grown on the grounds.

I've been to Orchid Fest several times, and it never disappoints. The orchids are brilliantly displayed from the moment you walk in. Hard to believe there are so many varieties. What a beautiful and marvelous creation. Look for the chocolate one. It really smells like chocolate.

I've been to Orchid Fest several times, and it never disappoints. The orchids are brilliantly displayed from the moment you walk in. Hard to believe there are so many varieties. What a beautiful and marvelous creation. Look for the chocolate one. It really smells like chocolate.

This is perfect for beating the winter blues which is why I went during the orchid show.  The fresh green smell of the plants, the vibrant orchids, and multiple butterflies took those blues right away. Besides butterflies there is a handful of other animals roaming around for kids to look out for. The only downside was that the outdoor garden was not in bloom yet and  I wish there was a little more to the indoor garden.

I absolutely adore this place. Walking around the gardens in the spring and summer, it is one of the most peaceful places in the city. I could happily lose myself here for an entire day and marvel at all of the beautiful and interesting plant life. There are so many different gardens to enjoy, and kids love their children’s garden which allows them to get hands-on and play. The indoor gardens complete with butterfly sanctuary are a great winter escape, especially if you visit during orchid mania. Breathtaking!

Very pretty and lots to see!  Even better when its warm out.
Just went to orchids Mania and it was so amazing to see the variety of orchids. Never knew that there were that many different kinds of orchids.
Bad weather...lol
Weatherhead School of Management è una business school privata in Cleveland, Ohio. La sua struttura principale è l'edificio "Peter B. Lewis" bellissima architettura di Frank Gehry costruita nel 2002.

One of the best pizzas I've ever had. You can tell they slightly overcook the cheese to create a uniquely delicious texture. Otherwise, the service was fantastic, and the atmosphere was akin to eating family dinners in my grandmother's basement. A must-visit for the best in Italian comfort food.

Highly disappointed. Pasta sauce was smokey flavored. Maybe burnt? Almost inedible.... but was so hungry that I ate my ravioli dish anyhow.  A generic store bought sauce would have been 100× better.  No children's menu, so had to pay full adult price for a spaghetti with meatballs dish that my daughter didn't eat because the sauce was so bad ( my fault for not ordering sauce on the side). To make it worse, the service wasn't good. We had to request water three times before waitress brought it out. No, we didn't complain to management, but no one asked either.... just tried to get out as soon as possible.  

Most other patrons seemed to have ordered pizza, so if you find yourself there you might try that. I advise against trying anything else.
Cozy family style Italian food. Reasonably priced. They've been there for generations. All of their sauces are homemade. Very friendly service as well.

Great prices, pretty basic fare. It was my first time dining in Little Italy, and a positive experience overall. I dined with a group of 5, and among other items to share we ordered a pizza, which was actually sent out with a takeout order, so it took quite a while to get, but all other food was received promptly, and in the meantime we were given free pasta sides to hold us over. The service was great, and the prices are good enough to overlook the misstep anyway.  I'll definitely be returning.

On a side note, as a precaution, parking on Mayfield is nearly impossible so don't even try. There is a parking lot on the north side of the rapid station.
Mama Santa's was amazing! Our waitress was so nice and had great recommendations. The food was wonderful. We will be back next time we're in Cleveland!

Tucked into a building called Golden Plaza. Very fast service and the food was really good. Friend said it was the best pho he's ever had. Food prices were very low and the portions are huge! Restaurant was very packed and I can see why. Server was friendly and helpful.

What do you do when a place that provides excellent food has a cockroach climbing up the wall? In my case I give them 3 stars and this review. 
The food was excellent. However, the stripped down design of the restaurant now seems to be designed around catching vermin easily. I didn't take pictures because there was nothing to take a picture of, just white walls, floor to ceiling. 
I hope the owners read this, because out of hundreds of reviews, I have only been exposed to cockroaches twice. 
So you are doing something wrong and risking the health of your patrons by doing so.
Please fix it. Extermination seems to be established science, with cockroaches being so rare. Spend some of money you are earning from selling more expensive pho than your competitors around the corner on fixing it.

Superior pho is a great place to grab lunch or to sit down with a group of friends and have a drink. They have great Vietnamese food and delicious sandwiches. I've been able to go there several times and the quality of the food remains superb every time. It is definitely a place to visit if you have a taste for Vietnamese food.
This is such a beloved spot. Excellent pho, and they're always so accommodating for my large and raucous group of friends. We meet there quite often, and have always been treated well.

The pho noodle soup dishes are so good here. The broth really got a lot better since I last visited. Noodles are cooked to perfection, not too soft or hard. I like that they provide small bowls, for those days that you just want a lighter lunch. Very good. Highly recommend.

A little corner shop for organic ice cream. The decor is pretty and minimal with lots of plants and they offer ice cream made using fresh cream and frozen right in front of you using liquid nitrogen. Tried the strawberry balsamic with brownie bites, which was delicious and tasted natural as it should. The brownie bites are a must have. Would love to try the other flavors.

Very handsome, cozy space, and a nice variety of interesting flavors, including goat cheese/honey/fig. Not cheap, and the carbon dioxide can seem a little gimmicky (and definitely slows down service), but still a tasty product and a fun alternative for ice cream lovers.
Informative and eager. Try the goat cheese honey and fig ice cream, promise it's heaven for cheesecake lovers. Super creamy and lightweight, not heavy on the stomach at all.

You can't find ice cream like this. Custom made, chilled with liquid nitrogen, and to-order mixins and toppings set this apart from other places. The staff has always been cordial to our family and seating is generally easy to get (easier in summer with the patio).
My fav is the goat cheese honey ice cream. They whip it up super fresh right then and there.
The people and their service is great, food is fresh, delicious and properly prepared. I also like the ambiance. It's cozy.
Cozy atmosphere. Excellent authentic Italian. Favorite place in Little Italy
Delicious! Great menu and service. Very quaint so make sure you have a reservation

Delightful small restaurant with great food. Atmosphere was conducive to conversation. Our server (Pasquale) was quite knowledgeable about both the food and wine. His recommendations on both were spot on. Definitely a place to go back to.
Excellent food. Very authentic. Our server was fabulous and handsome

First visit to Slyman’s and it did not disappoint. Never had corned beef before but so glad I ordered it here first! So great on grilled rye with cheese and mayo. Got it without sauerkraut though. It was perfect and the meat was stacked a mile high. Could only eat half! The lunch line was literally out the door but went very quickly. Did not take long at all to receive food. Quaint little place but so busy. Hope to return if I ever make it back to Cleveland.

First visit to Slyman’s and it did not disappoint. Never had corned beef before but so glad I ordered it here first! So great on grilled rye with cheese and mayo. Got it without sauerkraut though. It was perfect and the meat was stacked a mile high. Could only eat half! The lunch line was literally out the door but went very quickly. Did not take long at all to receive food. Quaint little place but so busy. Hope to return if I ever make it back to Cleveland.

I'm in heaven after eating here - this place is amazing! As you can see from from the picture, I opened up the sandwich to have an easier time at it and ate it with my fork. It was massive! 
I tried all combinations of sauces: mustard only, mayonnaise, thousand island, coleslaw, I think I liked the thousand island with coleslaw the best. Dyce was a terrific waitress. She was kind, funny, friendly and very personable. I'll be back!

This is the local deli you’ve been looking for. Corned beef or pastrami, you can’t go wrong. Meat piled high, flavors perfect, wax paper holding it all together. The staff treats you like royalty, even if you can’t make up your mind. Just show up, I promise you’ll love it!

Slyman's Restaurant is always good for corned beef. They go through hundreds of pounds of it each day so you know it is always fresh. This is the place I have been going to for corned beef for 15 years. The best part is they pile it high. At lunch time there might be a line out the door literally, but it is worth it even in winter times. Thank God they serve quick. Also they do have the option to order the corned beef lean. They close a little early, but they also open early. Everything I had from there was great.
Excellent spot for delicious Brazilian food. I give this spot two thumbs up. The service was sociable and attentive. This place has a nice atmosphere. This place has great reviews for a reason.
Relaxed intimate atmosphere. Creative menu. The Ricky Richardo mojito is awesome. The coconut cake is to die for. Food is well prepared. Service (Sam) outstanding.

Never had this style of Brazilian. Very different from a Brazilian steak house feel. Very intimate. The wait staff was wonderful and explained what was what. The food was extremely fresh and full of flavor. A great spot for an intimate date.

Amazing. If you want a true homemade meal this is the place to be. You can honestly tell they care about each plate/ meal they put on your table. I have been here multiple times with different guests and each one of them has fallen in love with the quality and service they provide. From appetizers to specialty drinks you CANNOT go wrong with anything you order.

Wonderful restaurant on Larchmere.  Great atmosphere but, be prepared to be squeezed into a table.  My wife and I both had seafood dishes that were outrageously good.  Soft grilled cheese with honey appetizer was excellent and the coconut cake recommended by our server with their Brazilian coffee was a homerun.
French food at this spot - yummy. It was so fresh. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The place has a great feel to it. Menu is similar to a restaurant in Jacksonville I liked.

Amazing food! Extremely authentic french traditional dishes and a wonderful atmosphere. Service was excellent and the prices were quite reasonable for the incredible quality of the food. You have to try the cheese platter!

Our group of 6 spent several hours at this French restaurant. The food was all wonderful, and the service was excellent. It seemed that each restaurant employee checked on us periodically. Our wait staff knew the menu perfectly and could describe flavors and make recommendations. The decor is European Modern and the food is the star f the show. Prices were reasonable for this high quality of food and service.
Exceptional French cuisine served in a fun and trendy area of Cleveland. Knowledgeable and friendly staff and a beautiful restaurant. The cheese platter is 10/10!

Absolutely loved this place. Please make reservations before visiting as this place is quite busy,no wonder why- the food is delicious,the ambience is great and the staff is very inviting and friendly. Vegetarians,the pasta is a must try!!

We were in Cleveland a few months back for a heart procedure my father-in-law was having performed. In an effort to change the tune and control the mood, I remembered a show I saw on Food Network called "Best Thing I Ever Ate." The main dish was an artichoke and as luck would have it the restaurant able to claim this delectable dinner was none other than The Edwin located a few miles from where our hotel resided. My husband, my brother-in-law, and I will never forget the hospitality of the staff and of course the amazing meal that we shared that night. That is why months later it is still a main topic of discussion. The night sort of started on a whim after I remembered the show and how much I wanted to try this artichoke dish. A few days after Thanksgiving the largest winter storm last year up to that point hit right as we arrived at The Edwin and we found ourselves stuck. That is  a poor choice of words because the word "stuck" itself suggest that you are in a place you would prefer not to be. That could not have been further from the truth. All of the staff from top to bottom along with their delicious cuisine took all of our minds off of the pending procedure my father in law was having done the follow morning. We could not be more grateful. Everything The Edwin is and stands for made a night that could have otherwise been filled with anxiety and apprehension overflow with laughter, full hearts, and full stomachs. Can't wait to visit them all again. Your new friends from Cincinnati and Colombia!!!
The food was amazing! The service was excellent! One of the best restaurants in Cleveland. Highly recommend it! Already looking forward to coming here again.

Cleveland Restaurant week gave us a reason to finally make it to Edwin's. I have long admired that this establishment gives a second chance after incarceration. What I didn't know was what how well the team serves a total dining experience. While there were a few small flaws, these people have their hearts and souls in service. The food, ambiance and service was top notch. I enjoyed sharing the escargot along with the special 3 course dinner featuring salad, salmon and creme brule. Everything was delicious. It was a very busy Saturday night, yet Brandon the founder was very visible and made a point to welcome us.

This place is amazing. The cheese board is rolled out *on a cart*. Your Banana Foster (or Burger) is prepared *tableside*. A great training restaurant that employs ex-cons to prepare them for the world. Huge wine list and awesome staff. Try the Banana Foster's - its the best I've ever had!

absolutely amazing meal here. we ordered off the menu ancien, enjoying dishes made from recipes in the 1780's and 1830's. the meal was delicious, the service warm and gracious, and great overall ambiance.
